markdown:
<title
    level="1"
    right="Item 20"
    pfs=""
>
[The Carnival](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2477)
</title>

<spoilers>May contain spoilers from Stolen Fate</spoilers>

<traits>
<trait label="Unique" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=161" />
<trait label="Artifact" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=253" />
<trait label="Divination" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=47" />
<trait label="Harrow Court" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=496" />
<trait label="Invested" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=98" />
<trait label="Magical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=103" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Pathfinder #190: The Choosing](/Sources.aspx?ID=198) pg. 76</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** carried

</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

_The Carnival_ represents false dreams. When you have _The Carnival_ invested, your flat check DCs to obtain reliable information from [divination](/Traits.aspx?ID=47) effects (such as [_augury_](/Spells.aspx?ID=15) or [_read fate_](/Spells.aspx?ID=445), or the activation of this card) are reduced by 2 (but not to less than 2). Casting a divination effect with a flat check, whether or not the flat check succeeds, gives a series of subtly different visions that don't confuse the meaning but make you [stupefied 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=37) for 1 round. If you're at least 17th level, the flat check is instead reduced by 3.

<document level="2" id="action-2025" />

<column gap="tiny">

</column>
name: The Carnival
